title: Why was the Renaissance important to Columbus’s voyages and exploration? - Quora

response.answer_text: There were two important technological innovations that played critical roles in Columbus’s voyages. The first was the development of the printing press. Gutenberg printed the Bible about the time of Columbus's birth, and the rapid spread of printing technology, particularly in Italy, enable to Columbus to have access to important writings. Columbus was a voracious reader and a dedicated student, and the availability of books in labeled him to develop a plan for what he referred to as the Enterprise of the Indies. It also enabled the success of Columbus is first voyage to be published across Europe. His account of the first voyage was published in Italy and became an immediate bestseller, going through three printings before the end of the year after his return. The second piece of important technology was the development of smaller and swifter sailing vessels by the Portuguese. These smaller boards were much easier to maneuver and better for sailing against the wind, yet were fast enough to make an ocean crossing possible.
